tags.name: cds-alert-actions
tags.description:
Web component alert actions to be used inside app-level alert.

```typescript
import '@clr/core/alert';
```

```html
<cds-app-alert>
    <cds-alert-content>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet</cds-alert-content>
    <cds-alert-actions>
       <cds-button>Fix</cds-button>
    </cds-alert-actions>
</cds-app-alert>
```

tags.name: cds-alert
tags.description:
Alerts are banners that communicate a message with a severity attached to it.
They grab the user’s attention to provide critical information needed in context.

```typescript
import '@clr/core/alert';
```

```html
<cds-alert>
   <cds-alert-content>This is an alert.</cds-alert-content>
</cds-alert>
```

Slots:

  * `default` {} - Content slot for inside the alert. Usually will contain at least a <cds-alert-content> component.

Properties:

  * `size` {`"default" | "sm"`} - Sets the overall height and width of the alert and icon based on value

  * `closedChange` - 

  * `closable` {`boolean`} - If false, the alert will not render the close button.

  * `status` {`"info" | "success" | "warning" | "danger"`} - Sets the color of the alert from a predefined list of statuses

  * `iconShape` {`string`} - Sets the icon shape to be used to override the default icon. The application must import the icon shape.

  * `iconTitle` {`string`} - Sets the title attribute for the icon. This may need to be set especially if the component is using custom icon shape.

  * `buttons` - 

  * `alertIconShape` - 

  * `alertIconTitle` -

tags.name: cds-app-alert
tags.description:
App-level alerts are placed at the very top of the global context. They should
not be placed in any other configuration. Their purpose is to provide global
alerts available and relating to the full context of the overall application.

```typescript
import '@clr/core/alert';
```

```html
<cds-app-alert>
  <cds-alert-content>This is an app alert.</cds-alert-content>
</cds-app-alert>
```

Slots:

  * `default` {} - Content slot for inside the alert. Usually will contain at least a <cds-alert-content> component.

Properties:

  * `closedChange` - 

  * `closable` {`boolean`} - If false, the alert will not render the close button.

  * `status` {`"info" | "warning" | "danger"`} - Sets the color of the alert from a predefined list of statuses

  * `iconShape` {`string`} - Sets the icon shape to be used to override the default icon. The application must import the icon shape.

  * `iconTitle` {`string`} - Sets the title attribute for the icon. This may need to be set especially if the component is using custom icon shape.

  * `buttons` - 

  * `alertIconShape` - 

  * `alertIconTitle` -

tags.name: cds-badge
tags.description:
Badges provide a method to highlight a count of an element either next to it
or inside the element itself.

```typescript
import '@clr/core/badge';
```

```html
<cds-badge status="info">2</cds-badge>
```

Slots:

  * `default` {} - Content slot for inside the badge

Properties:

  * `color` {`"gray" | "purple" | "blue" | "orange" | "light-blue"`} - Sets the color of the badge from the following predefined list of choices:
'gray', 'purple', 'blue', 'orange', 'light-blue'

  * `status` - Sets the color of the badge from the following predefined list of statuses:
'info', 'success', 'warning', 'danger'

tags.name: cds-badge
tags.description:
Badges provide a method to highlight a count of an element either next to it
or inside the element itself.

```typescript
import '@clr/core/badge';
```

```html
<cds-badge status="info">2</cds-badge>
```

Slots:

  * `default` {} - Content slot for inside the badge

tags.name: cds-button
tags.description:
Buttons allow an application to communicate action and direct user intent.

```typescript
import '@clr/core/button';
```

```html
<cds-button>submit</cds-button>
```

Slots:

  * `default` {} - Content slot for inside the button

Properties:

  * `action` {`"solid" | "outline" | "flat"`} - Define the type of action the button triggers

- `solid`: buttons direct the user’s attention to the primary action the application is suggesting that the user take.
- `outline`: buttons indicate secondary actions that compliments a primary action or reduces visual noise when there are many actions on the page.
- `flat`: buttons are used as tertiary buttons. Can also be used inline because they are different from content in style and recognizable as buttons alongside content.

  * `status` {`"success" | "danger" | "primary" | "inverse"`} - Sets the color of the button to match the following string statuses

  * `size` {`"sm" | "md" | "icon"`} - Sets the overall height and width of the button based on the following string values:

  * `block` {`boolean`} - Sets if the button should be full width with display block

  * `privateHost` {`HTMLElement`} - 

  * `loadingState` {`ClrLoadingState`} - Changes the button content based on the value passed.

- `default`: shows the content of the button
- `loading`: disables the button and shows a spinner inside the button
- `success`: disables the button and shows a check mark inside the button; auto-triggers to change back to DEFAULT state after 1000 ms
- `error`: shows the content of the button (in the context of application, this state is usually entered from a LOADING state. the application should show appropriate error message)

  * `updateLoadingState` - 

  * `disableButton` - 

  * `enableButton` -

tags.name: cds-button
tags.description:
Buttons allow an application to communicate action and direct user intent.

```typescript
import '@clr/core/button';
```

```html
<cds-button>submit</cds-button>
```

Slots:

  * `default` {} - Content slot for inside the button

Properties:

  * `loadingState` - Changes the button content based on the value passed.

- `default`: shows the content of the button
- `loading`: disables the button and shows a spinner inside the button
- `success`: disables the button and shows a check mark inside the button; auto-triggers to change back to DEFAULT state after 1000 ms
- `error`: shows the content of the button (in the context of application, this state is usually entered from a LOADING state. the application should show appropriate error message)

tags.name: cds-icon
tags.description:
Icon component that renders svg shapes that can be customized.
To load an icon, import the icon with the icon service.

```typescript
import '@clr/core/icon';
import { ClarityIcons, userIcon } from '@clr/core/icon-shapes';

ClarityIcons.addIcons(userIcon);
```

```html
<cds-icon shape="user"></cds-icon>
```

Properties:

  * `_shape` - 

  * `_size` - 

  * `shape` {`string`} - Changes the svg glyph displayed in the icon component. Defaults to the 'unknown' icon if
the specified icon cannot be found in the icon registry.

  * `size` {`string`} - Apply numerical width-height or a t-shirt-sized CSS classname

  * `title` {`string`} - If present, customizes the aria-label for the icon for accessibility.

  * `dir` - 

  * `direction` - Takes a directional value (up|down|left|right) that rotates the icon 90° with the
top of the icon pointing in the specified direction.

  * `flip` - Takes an orientation value (horizontal|vertical) that reverses the orientation of the
icon vertically or horizontally using the strings: 'horizontal' or 'vertical'

  * `solid` {`boolean`} - Displays most icons in their "filled" version if set to `true`.

  * `status` - Changes color of icon fills and outlines to a color determined by the following
list of statuses: 'info', 'success', 'warning', 'danger', 'highlight'

  * `inverse` {`boolean`} - Inverts color of icon fills and outlines if `true`.
Useful for displaying icons on a dark background.

  * `badge` - Attribute: `badge`
Sets the color of the icon decoration that appears in the top-right corner
of the glyph. The icon decoration is derived from the following predefined types.

The color of the badge can change according to the following
list of statuses:
'info'  -> blue dot
'success' -> green dot
'warning' -> yellow dot
'danger' -> red dot
'inherit' -> dot inherits color of full icon glyph
'warning-triangle' -> yellow triangle
'inherit-triangle' -> triangle inherits color of full icon glyph
unrecognized value, empty string, or true -> red dot

By default, the badge displays a 'danger' dot (a red-colored dot).

Setting the badge to 'null' removes the attribute from the DOM.

  * `svg` - 

  * `idForAriaLabel` - 

  * `updateSVGAriaLabel` -

To load an icon, import the icon with the icon service.


```html

```

Properties:

  * `shape` - Changes the svg glyph displayed in the icon component. Defaults to the 'unknown' icon if
the specified icon cannot be found in the icon registry.

  * `size` - Apply numerical width-height or a t-shirt-sized CSS classname

  * `solid` {`boolean`} - Displays most icons in their "filled" version if set to `true`.

  * `status` {`string`} - Changes color of icon fills and outlines to a color determined by the following
list of statuses: 'info', 'success', 'warning', 'danger', 'highlight'

  * `inverse` {`boolean`} - Inverts color of icon fills and outlines if `true`.
Useful for displaying icons on a dark background.

  * `idForAriaLabel` {`string`} -

tags.name: cds-test-dropdown
tags.description:
Dropdown, example test component. Do not use in production.

```typescript
import '@clr/core/test-dropdown';
```

```html
<cds-test-dropdown title="click me!">
   Hello World
</cds-test-dropdown>
```

Events:

  * `openChange` {`boolean`} - notify open state change of dropdown

Slots:

  * `default` {} - Content slot for dropdown content

Properties:

  * `openChange` - 

  * `_open` - 

  * `open` {`boolean`} - Set open to open or close the dropdown

  * `title` {`string`} - Set the dropdown button text

attributes.name: onopenChange
attributes.description: `openChange` {`boolean`} - notify open state change of dropdown

tags.name: cds-tag
tags.description:
Tags show concise metadata in a compact format.
Tags are visually styled to differentiate them from buttons.

```typescript
import '@clr/core/tag';
```

```html
<cds-tag status="info">Info</cds-tag>
```

Slots:

  * `default` {} - Content slot for inside the tag

Properties:

  * `status` - Sets the color of the tag (and badge if present) from the following predefined list of statuses:
'info', 'success', 'warning', 'danger'

  * `color` {`"gray" | "purple" | "blue" | "orange" | "light-blue"`} - Sets the color of the tag (and badge if present) from a predefined list of choices

tags.name: cds-tag
